p: Disputes relating to care and residence of children have become more complex and more common. Within three weeks of the pandemic hitting Australia, the Family Court of Australia and the Federal Circuit Court transitioned into digital delivery. These courts created a ‘COVID List’ to deal digitally with urgent COVID-related cases with decisions being made within 72 hours. The suggestion for this proactive court list to address these cases came from the Women’s Legal Service in Queensland, informed by the prevalence of domestic violence history in cases coming before family law courts.16
